body_html:
@ZiangYan We are actively working on improving Bazel's autoconfiguration support. We appreciate your patience.

@lberki, @ulfjack - it seems that the C++ toolchain configuration does not follow symlinks for builtin include directories. I ran into this issue as well while working on #2873. Even though /usr/local/cuda is a symlink to /usr/local/cuda-7.5, as other users have pointed out, cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/usr/local/cuda/include" still produces this error while cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/usr/local/cuda-7.5/include" does not. Is this a bug?

body:
@ZiangYan We are actively working on improving Bazel's autoconfiguration support. We appreciate your patience.

@lberki, @ulfjack - it seems that the C++ toolchain configuration does not follow symlinks for builtin include directories. I ran into this issue as well while working on #2873. Even though `/usr/local/cuda` is a symlink to `/usr/local/cuda-7.5`, as other users have pointed out, `cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/usr/local/cuda/include"` still produces this error while `cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/usr/local/cuda-7.5/include"` does not. Is this a bug?
